name: Reiverse Demo
description:
You find yourself in a strange world, with no memory of how you got there. The only other person there says he knows what's going on, but warns you to be ready first. Will you find a way home and learn the truth about yourself, or will you stay trapped here forever...?

Features

  • Small open world
  • A unified interaction system; use any action on any interactable entity
  • Craft any existing recipe with any combination of materials (There's only one recipe right now...)
  • Hybrid action and turn-based combat
  • Simple branching storyline (two paths in this demo)

Be aware that this is a minimum viable product or proof of concept. I've mainly been working on the systems and have focused less on the art and content. I plan to spend a lot more time on the art and content now that I have this foundation to build on.

Some features planned for the full release (not in the demo):

  • Storyline organized into three episodes 
    • Each one takes place in a separate world 
    • Each one has multiple endings
    • They advance in real-time, without waiting for you to act like traditional RPGs; if you want a certain ending, you'll have to overcome challenges at specific times
  • Each world is procedurally generated, with a small selection out of the possible biomes each time, increasing replayability
  • Everything will have a reaction to most actions and even to certain items, providing a reason to experiment
  • Different weapons and materials will have different attack speeds, and enemies will try to dodge your attacks. Strike when the enemy is at a pause in its movements
  • Unlike in this demo, battles will take place in the overworld. Use the scenery to block enemy attacks, or place walls of your own before battle for an advantage!
  • More materials and crafting recipes...! (Of course)
  • Emotional, mysterious, slightly surreal story about alternate realities

You can follow me on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/floriankeystudios/ I plan to post updates on my progress regularly. I'll also probably branch out to other social media platforms in the future.
